item.title: 保险公司 Parametrix 称，财富 500 强企业将因 CrowdStrike 损失 54 亿美元
item.description: 美国财富 500 强企业（不包括微软）将因最近的 CrowdStrike 将面临 54 亿美元的经济损失。【原文：U.S. Fortune 500 companies, excluding Microsoft , will face $5.4 billion in financial losses from the recent CrowdStrike outage, insurer Parametrix said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 特斯拉下滑，惨淡的利润率暴露出对经济型电动汽车的需求
item.description: 特斯拉股价周三在美股盘前交易中下跌 8%，原因是这家电动汽车制造商的利润率跌至五年来的最低点，这凸显了生产低价汽车以促进销售而非依赖降价的紧迫性。【原文：Tesla shares slid 8% in U.S. pre-market trades on Wednesday after the electric vehicle maker's profit margin fell to a five-year low, raising the urgency of making lower-priced vehicles to power sales rather than relying on price cuts.】

item.title: 德意志银行称商业地产仍面临压力
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank）周三降低了对商业房地产市场复苏的预期，并表示预计下半年将面临更大压力。【原文：Deutsche Bank on Wednesday tempered exepectations for a recovery in the commercial real estate market and said it forecasts further pressure in the second half of the year.】

item.title: 早间竞标高收益门槛，哈里斯民调上升
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 美国结束对 150 万辆本田汽车动力损失的调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周三表示，已结束对约150万辆本田汽车动力损失的初步评估调查。【原文：The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday it has closed a preliminary evaluation investigation of about 1.5 million Honda vehicles over loss of power.】

item.title: 加拿大央行将降息并更新对通胀和 GDP 的预测
item.description: 经济学家和分析师表示，在通胀放缓、就业市场疲软和经济增长乏力的情况下，普遍预计加拿大央行（BOC）将于周三将其关键隔夜利率下调25个基点。【原文：The Bank of Canada (BoC) is widely expected to trim its key overnight rate by 25 basis points on Wednesday amid slowing inflation, a weak job market and tepid economic growth, economists and analysts said.】

item.title: 利润率低、燃料需求疲软导致美国炼油商第二季度利润下降
item.description: 能源分析师表示，夏季驾车旺季无精打采，削弱了炼油利润，预计美国炼油企业第二季度盈利将同比大幅下降。【原文：U.S. oil refiners are expected to report sharply lower second quarter earnings from a year ago after a listless summer driving season that weakened refining margins, energy analysts said.】

item.title: 马来西亚要求微软和 CrowdStrike 考虑弥补全球故障造成的损失
item.description: 马来西亚数字部长周三表示，他已要求全球科技公司微软（Microsoft）和CrowdStrike考虑对在上周全球技术故障中遭受损失的公司进行赔偿。【原文：Malaysia's digital minister said on Wednesday he has asked global tech firms Microsoft and CrowdStrike to consider compensating companies that suffered losses during last week's global tech outage.】

item.title: 宝马将召回约 29 万辆美国汽车，原因是后货栏可能在碰撞中脱落
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周三表示，宝马将在美国召回291,112辆汽车，因为这些汽车的车内货物导轨可能会在后部碰撞时脱落，从而增加受伤风险。【原文：BMW is recalling 291,112 vehicles in the U.S. as their interior cargo rail may detach during a rear crash, which can increase the risk of injury, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家报道日本央行将在下周权衡加息，并详细说明减半购买债券的计划
item.description: 消息人士称，日本央行下周召开会议时可能会就是否加息进行辩论，并公布一项在未来几年将债券购买量大致减半的计划，这表明日本央行决心稳步放松大规模货币刺激政策。【原文：The Bank of Japan is likely to debate whether to raise interest rates when it meets next week and unveil a plan to roughly halve bond purchases in coming years, sources said, signaling its resolve to steadily unwind its massive monetary stimulus.】

item.title: Lilium 将于今年开始研究美国空中出租车组装地点
item.description: 总部位于德国的 Lilium 公司首席执行官说，该公司计划今年晚些时候开始研究在美国建立空中出租车组装厂的可能性，目标是在 2029 年初建成并运行一家工厂，从而在这个世界最大的市场之一站稳脚跟。【原文：Germany-based Lilium plans to begin studying possible air-taxi assembly sites in the U.S. later this year with a goal of having a plant up and running by early 2029 to get a foothold in the one of the world's largest markets, its CEO said.】

item.title: 大型科技公司首份财报令人失望，纳斯达克指数期货下滑
item.description: 与纳斯达克指数挂钩的期货周三大幅下跌，原因是特斯拉和 Alphabet 的季度财报凸显了投资者对大型科技股主导地位的担忧，这些股票已将华尔街推升至历史新高。【原文：Futures tied to the Nasdaq fell sharply on Wednesday, as quarterly earnings from Tesla and Alphabet underscored investor concerns around the dominance of Big Tech stocks that have boosted Wall Street to all-time highs.】

item.title: 数据显示，中国比亚迪扩大了在新加坡和东南亚电动汽车市场对特斯拉的领先优势
item.description: 政府数据显示，今年上半年，中国比亚迪在新加坡的销量领先特斯拉的幅度有所扩大，这凸显出这家全球最大的电动汽车制造商面临着来自中国竞争对手销量的挑战。【原文：China's BYD widened its sales lead over Tesla in Singapore in the first half of this year, government data showed, highlighting the challenge facing the world's biggest electric vehicle maker by sales from Chinese rivals.】

item.title: PMI 数据显示英国 7 月商业活动回暖
item.description: 周三的一项主要调查显示，英国商业活动本月有所回升，制造业增长速度为两年来最快，新订单流入量也是自 2023 年 4 月以来最强劲的。【原文：British business activity picked up this month, bolstered by the fastest manufacturing growth in two years and the strongest inflow of new orders since April 2023, a major survey showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧元区 7 月采购经理人指数显示企业增长停滞
item.description: 周三的一项调查显示，欧元区本月的商业活动增长停滞不前，原因是该集团占主导地位的服务业增长乏力，未能抵消制造商更严重的衰退。【原文：Growth in euro zone business activity stalled this month as a tepid expansion in the bloc's dominant services industry failed to offset a deeper downturn among manufacturers, a survey showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: Informa 将以 16 亿美元收购戛纳国际电影节所有者 Ascential
item.description: 英国 Informa 公司周三表示，已达成以 12 亿英镑（16 亿美元）收购戛纳国际广告节所有者 Ascential 公司的协议，将这一广告业旗舰会议纳入其活动组合。【原文：Britain's Informa said on Wednesday it had reached a deal to buy Cannes Lions Festival owner Ascential for 1.2 billion pounds ($1.6 billion), adding the flagship ad industry conference to its portfolio of events.】

item.title: LVMH 第二季度业绩不及预期，股价暴跌 4
item.description: 法国奢侈品巨头路威酩轩集团（LVMH）公布的第二季度销售增长低于一致预期，该公司股价在周三开盘时下跌超过 4%。【原文：Shares in French luxury giant LVMH dropped more than 4% at the market open on Wednesday after the company reported second-quarter sales growth below consensus estimates.】

item.title: NIQ 表示，阳光、足球和促销活动刺激了英国食品杂货消费
item.description: 周三的行业数据显示，6 月底一周的炎热夏季天气、英格兰队闯入 2024 年欧洲杯足球赛决赛以及品牌商品促销活动推动了上个月英国食品杂货的销售。【原文：A week of hot summer weather at the end of June, England reaching the final of the Euro 2024 soccer championship and promotions on branded goods drove UK grocery sales over the last month, industry data showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据《消息报》报道，俄罗斯考虑禁止柴油出口
item.description: 据《消息报》周三援引几位不愿透露姓名的消息人士的话报道，由于国内柴油价格上涨，俄罗斯政府正在考虑禁止柴油出口。【原文：The Russian government is considering a ban on exports of diesel due to rising domestic prices, the Kommersant daily reported on Wednesday, citing several unnamed sources.】

item.title: 美国四座城市的酒店员工将举行罢工授权投票
item.description: 由于与万豪国际集团、希尔顿全球控股公司和凯悦酒店集团的合同谈判陷入僵局，美国四个城市的约 13500 名酒店工会员工计划在下个月进行罢工授权投票。【原文：About 13,500 unionized hotel workers in four U.S. cities plan strike authorization votes next month as contract talks with Marriott International , Hilton Worldwide Holdings and Hyatt Hotels Corp stall, the union said.】

item.title: 保时捷力争在上半年业绩疲软后恢复生产并提高利润率
item.description: 保时捷表示，在供应链受阻、电动车需求放缓以及中国市场销售下滑对上半年业绩造成影响后，该公司正在努力恢复产量，并重新确定支出的优先次序。【原文：Porsche said it was fighting to restore production volumes and to re-prioritise spending after supply chain snags, slow EV demand and a sales slump in China weighed on results in the first half.】

item.title: 人头马君度酒第一季度销售额降幅超出预期，美国困境仍在继续
item.description: 人头马君度（Remy Cointreau）周三报告称，第一季度销售额下降 15.6%，降幅超出预期，原因是其美国干邑部门所面临的困难波及到了利口酒和烈酒部门。【原文：Remy Cointreau reported a wider-than-expected 15.6% decline in first-quarter sales on Wednesday, as difficulties hurting its U.S. cognac division spread to its liqueurs and spirits unit.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行交易收入大增，业绩超出预期
item.description: 法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas）周三公布的季度收益好于预期，得益于股票交易的激增，投资银行业务收入大幅增长，抵消了法国零售业务净利息收入的急剧下降。【原文：France's BNP Paribas posted better-than-expected quarterly earnings on Wednesday after investment banking revenue jumped thanks to a surge in equities trading, offsetting a sharp drop in net interest income in its French retail business.】

item.title: 德意志银行因巨额诉讼拨备而结束连年盈利
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank）周三披露，该行第二季度出现亏损，这是德意志银行四年来首次出现亏损，此前德意志银行为投资者因收购邮政银行而引发的旷日持久的诉讼拨备了 13 亿欧元（14.1 亿美元）。【原文：Deutsche Bank posted a loss in the second quarter, it disclosed on Wednesday, its first in four years after setting aside 1.3 billion euros ($1.41 billion) as a provision for a protracted investor lawsuit over its Postbank acquisition.】

item.title: 独家报道：LG Energy Solution 与中国企业洽谈为欧洲生产低成本电动汽车电池事宜
item.description: 韩国LG能源解决方案公司（LGES）的一位高级管理人员表示，该公司正在与三家中国供应商谈判，为欧洲生产低成本电动汽车电池。【原文：South Korea's LG Energy Solution (LGES) is in talks with about three Chinese suppliers to produce low-cost electric vehicle batteries for Europe, a senior executive said, with competition set to intensify after the EU slapped extra tariffs on China-built EVs.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，利洁时被股东逼迫重新考虑营养品业务的出售事宜
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周三报道，在美赞臣营养品业务遭遇诉讼和其他挫折后，英国消费品公司利洁时正面临来自大股东的压力，要求其重新考虑出售美赞臣营养品业务。【原文：British consumer goods company Reckitt is under pressure from top shareholders to revisit a sale of its Mead Johnson Nutrition business, following litigation and other setbacks at the division, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价乏善可陈的收益令投资者惶恐不安
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 法官称 Rivian 将在特斯拉商业机密盗窃案中出庭受审
item.description: 根据加利福尼亚州一名法官做出的初步裁决，电动汽车制造商 Rivian Automotive 将因被指控鼓励从埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的特斯拉公司叛逃的员工窃取商业机密而受审。【原文：Electric car maker Rivian Automotive will go on trial over allegations that it encouraged its employees who defected from Elon Musk's Tesla to steal trade secrets, according to a tentative ruling issued by a California judge.】

item.title: 中国量化基金在打压中遭受严重损失
item.description: 数据显示，中国计算机驱动的 "量化 "对冲基金今年上半年损失惨重，表现逊于国内传统股票策略和其他流行的全球基金策略。【原文：Chinese computer-driven "quant" hedge funds suffered heavy losses in the first half of the year, underperforming traditional stocks strategies at home and other popular global fund strategies, data shows.】

item.title: 美国科技股收益令人失望，亚洲股市震荡；日元坚挺
item.description: 美国科技巨头特斯拉（Tesla）和 Alphabet 的财报乏善可陈，打压了市场情绪，周三亚洲股市低迷，而日元在下周央行会议前创下六周新高，会议仍将讨论加息问题。【原文：Asian stocks were subdued on Wednesday after lacklustre earnings from U.S. tech behemoths Tesla and Alphabet dented sentiment, while the yen hit a six-week high ahead of a central bank meeting next week where a rate hike remains on the table.】
